results.headline: Blue Angel, The
results.summary_short: He was an aging professor. She was a fickle cabaret singer. Theirs was a tale of lust and degradation in Weimar Germany. Josef von Sternberg, working from the Heinrich Mann novel "Professor Unrat" ("Professor Garbage"), told their story in "The Blue Angel." The film, with Emil Jannings as the hapless professor, catapulted Marlene Dietrich (1901-1992) to international stardom as the naughty Lola-Lola.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Blue Angel
